# TL;DR {background-color="#3287efff"}

::: r-fit-text
**We propose Cognitive-Aware Plugin for Vulnerability Feedback (CAPV), a Visual Studio Code plugin that integrates *static analysis*, *real-time cognitive and attentiveness metrics* from eye-tracking and webcams, and *large language models* to generate adaptive, personalized feedback for secure coding education.**
:::

## Motivation

-   Software vulnerability exploitation continues to be an issue and should be trained against [@sandersAnalysisSoftwareVulnerabilities2024; @yilmazUnderstandingSecurityVulnerabilities2022; @jointtaskforceoncomputingcurriculaassociationforcomputingmachineryacmandieeecomputersocietyComputerScienceCurricula2013; @departmentofhomelandsecurityus-certSoftwareAssurance; @verizonVerizon2023Data; @johnzorabedianVeracodeSurveyResearch]
-   Students graduate with security knowledge deficiencies and write insecure code [@lamIdentifyingGapsSecure2022; @sandersAnalysisSoftwareVulnerabilities2024]
-   Many existing approaches on the path to addressing this [@gasibaRankingSecureCoding2020; @kennetha.williamsTeachingSecureCoding2014; @dieterpawelczakTeachingSecurityIntroductory2020; @junzhuInteractiveSupportSecure2013; @chiTeachingSecureCoding2013]
    -   Adjusting computing curricula to include aspects of secure coding [@gasibaRankingSecureCoding2020; @kennetha.williamsTeachingSecureCoding2014; @dieterpawelczakTeachingSecurityIntroductory2020]
    -   Creating educational secure coding tools [@junzhuInteractiveSupportSecure2013; @chiTeachingSecureCoding2013]

## Prior Work: Large Language Models (LLM)

-   Use to help teach students secure coding?
    -   Used to generate tailored feedback in education [@liuTraditionalTeachingLarge2024]
    -   Shown potential in software vulnerability detection [@tambergHarnessingLargeLanguage2024]
    -   Used with static analysis tool outputs to mitigate cognitive load and create tailored feedback [@Sanders2025Pedalogical]
-   Issues?
    -   Direct use by students has weak learning outcomes [@prather2023robots; @macneil2023experiences]
    -   Students are weak at creating effective prompts [@denny2023conversing]

## Prior Work: Other Approaches?

-   Work has been done to study attention and cognitive patterns of students in classrooms from multi-modal data
    -   Attentiveness and comprehension prediction from webcams and/or eyetrackers [@nicats2021; @Elbawab2023MachineLA; @Xie2023StudentED]
-   Adaptive micro-learning system for managing cognitive load [@Zhu2024OptimizingCL]
-   Opportunities?
    -   Incorporating cognitive/attention data for secure coding feedback
    -   Using cognitive/attention data with LLMs for generating tailored feedback

## Proposed Approach: CAPV

-   Cognitive-Aware Plugin for Vulnerability Feedback
-   Effective software vulnerability feedback so programmers can learn to write more secure code
-   Three components, inspired from existing research:
    -   Vulnerability Analysis using static analysis tools. Provides grounding to mitigate LLM hallucinations.
    -   Cognitive/Attention prediction using machine learning
    -   LLM to provide effective, tailored feedback

## Theoretical Grounding

-   Cognitive Load Theory [@sweller2019cognitive]
    -   Reduce extraneous load by filtering raw outputs from static analysis
    -   Use cognitive/attentiveness prediction to match vulnerability difficulty to current working memory capacity
-   Zone of Proximal Development [@Vygotsky:78]
    -   Use LLM to provide tailored scaffolding based on student expertise and engagement with tool

## CAPV System Architecture

```{mermaid}
flowchart LR
    A["Gaze Data<br/>(eyetracker)"] -->
    B["Cognitive Level Prediction Module"]
    C["Face Images<br/>(webcam)"] --> D["Attentiveness Prediction Module<br/>(Convolutional Neural Network)"]
    E["Code File"] --> F["Vulnerability Analysis<br/>(SonarQube)"]
    B --> G["Vulnerabilty Selector Module"]
    D --> G
    F --> G
    G --> H["Large Language Model<br/>(Custom Few-Shot prompt)"]
    H --> I["Present Vulnerability Feedback to User"]
    
```

## Anticipated Outcomes
- Reductions in vulnerability introduction rates
- Improved efficiency in vulnerability detection and remediation
- Heightened user awareness and adoption of secure coding practices
